Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AV1}Averheim
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Averheim is the capital city of the Grand Province of Averland, and the original capital of the ancient Brigundians tribe.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AV1_1}Streissen
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AV1_1}Streissen is a town in Averland that harbors a ferry system, and a history of volatile conspiracy.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_AV1_4}Heideck
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_AV1_4}Heideck is an Imperial town located at the crossroads of the Old Dwarf Road just before reaching the capital of Averheim.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AV2_1}Calmfahre
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AV2_1}Tirby sits in the cold misty waters that lie off of the Ebor peninsula. The low-lying lands on the northern side of the Ebor are suited to the growing of flax.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_AV2_2}Loningbruck
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_AV2_2}Loningbruck is a small town in south-central Averland. Located at a major crossroads just north of the Upper Reik.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_AV3}Grenzstadt
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Grenzstadt is an Imperial fortress-town that is located at the northwestern end of Black Fire Pass.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ST1}Wurtbad
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Capital of Stirland, Wurtbad rests at the terminus of the Old Dwarf Road, surrounded by the Great Forest.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ST2}Leicheberg
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}At the edge of the Haunted Hills by the source of the Black Run River, Leicheberg lives in fear of its neighbour to the east.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ST3}Siegfriedhof
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Siegfriedhof lies on the borderlands with the County of Sylvania near Hunger Wood.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ST4}Mittlenburg
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Sir seaghouls place to hang out it's fresh mountainair for his boypussy

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_MT1}Eicheschatten
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Eicheschatten, the capital of the Mootland is utterly unprepossessing at first glance. After a longer examination, one’s opinion is confirmed.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_MT1_1}Gipfel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_MT1_1}Gipfel, A small village in the heart of the Greenleaf Hills.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_MT1}Castle Drakenhof
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}Castle Drakenhof was the former capital of the Imperial province of Sylvania during the reign of its last Imperial noble, Count Otto von Drak.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_SY1_1}Templehof
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_SY1_1}This town in Sylvania, bordering the imperial province of Stirland is named for its famed temple of Morr.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_SY2}Waldenhof
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}The capital of Sylvania, Waldenhof, is a walled town that sits where the rivers come together to create the Stir.
